sen.j: 行燈山古墳（あんどんやまこふん、あんどやまこふん、行灯とも書く）は、奈良県天理市柳本町に所在する古墳時代前期の前方後円墳である。
sen.e: Andonyama Tumulus ("行燈山古墳," or "行灯山古墳")is an ancient Japanese tumulus of a circular shape rear-end with a rectangular frontage, located at Yanagimoto-cho, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
Andonyama Tumulus is an ancient Japanese tumulus of a circular shape rear-end with a rectangular frontage, located at Yanagimoto-cho, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記の説明は不要と考え削除しました。
sen.e: Andonyama Tumulus is an ancient Japanese tumulus of a circular shape rear-end with a rectangular frontage, located at Yanagimoto-cho, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 本古墳は、龍王山の斜面の先端を利用して造られており、平野の方に前方部を北西に向けている。
sen.e: This tumulus was constructed at the foot of Ryuo-zan Mountain by utilizing the tip of a mountain slope, by facing its rectangular frontage side in north-west direction toward the level ground.
sen.cmt: 「平野の方に前方部を北西に向けている」など、多少原文がおかしいです。
sen.e: This tumulus was constructed at the foot of Ryuo-zan Mountain by utilizing the tip of a mountain slope, by facing its rectangular frontage side in north-west direction toward the level ground.
This tumulus was constructed at the foot of Ryuo-zan Mountain by utilizing the tip of a mountain slope, by facing its rectangular frontage side in north-west direction toward the level ground.

sen.j: 後円部がより高い山側にある。
sen.e: The circular rear-end part is situated on a higher ground of a hill.
The circular rear-end part is situated on a higher ground of a hill.
The circular rear-end part is situated on a higher ground of a hill.

sen.j: 三輪山の山麓に築かれた大和・柳本古墳群の中でも、渋谷向山古墳（現景行天皇陵）に次ぐ大きさであり、現崇神天皇陵（山辺道勾岡上陵）に比定されている。
sen.e: Andonyama Tumulus is the second largest tumulus next to Shibutani Mukouyama Tumulus (currently designated as The Imperial Mausoleum of Keiko Emperor) among Yamato/ Yanagimoto Tumulus Group scattered around the foot of Miwa-yama Mountain, and it is now specified as The Imperial Mausoleum of Sujin Emperor. ("Yamanobeno Michinomagarino Okanoeno Misasagi")

Andonyama Tumulus is the second largest tumulus next to Shibutani Mukouyama Tumulus (currently designated as the Imperial Mausoleum of Emperor Keiko) among Yamato/Yanagimoto Tumulus Group scattered around the foot of Miwa-yama Mountain, and it is now specified as the Imperial Mausoleum of Emperor Sujin (Yamanobeno Michinomagarino Okanoeno Misasagi).
sen.cmt: the 小文字にしました。Emperor Keikoに訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。Emperor Sujinに訂正しました。括弧内の" "を削除しました。ピリオドの位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: Andonyama Tumulus is the second largest tumulus next to Shibutani Mukouyama Tumulus (currently designated as the Imperial Mausoleum of Emperor Keiko) among Yamato/Yanagimoto Tumulus Group scattered around the foot of Miwa-yama Mountain, and it is now specified as the Imperial Mausoleum of Emperor Sujin (Yamanobeno Michinomagarino Okanoeno Misasagi).

sen.j: その政治勢力は、三輪王朝とか初瀬王朝と呼ばれている。
sen.e: The political influence of Sujin Emperor is known as Miwa Dynasty or Hatsuse Dynasty.
The political influence of Emperor Sujin is known as Miwa Court or Hatsuse Court.
sen.cmt: Emperor Sujinに訂正しました。Courtに訂正しました。
sen.e: The political influence of Emperor Sujin is known as Miwa Court or Hatsuse Court.

sen.j: 初期ヤマト政権の大王陵である。
sen.e: This is considered to be the tumulus of a great king (prior to the establishment of the Imperial Family) in early Yamato Sovereignty.
This is considered to be the tumulus of a great king (prior to the establishment of the Imperial Family) in early Yamato Sovereignty.
This is considered to be the tumulus of a great king (prior to the establishment of the Imperial Family) in early Yamato Sovereignty.

sen.j: 幕末の文久の修陵の開始時には、本古墳が景行陵だったのが、修陵事業の完成直前の1865年（慶応元）2月に、崇神陵に取り替えられた。
sen.e: Before the restoration of the mausoleum performed at the end of Edo period, (Bunkyu era) this tumulus had been designated as the Imperial Mausoleum of Emperor Keiko, although that was thoughtlessly changed to that of Sujin Emperor's in February 1865, right before the completion of the restoration.

Before the restoration of the mausoleum performed at the end of Edo period, (Bunkyu era) this tumulus had been designated as the Imperial Mausoleum of Emperor Keiko, although that was thoughtlessly changed to that of Emperor Sujin's in February 1865, right before the completion of the restoration.

Before the restoration of the mausoleum performed at the end of Edo period, (Bunkyu era) this tumulus had been designated as the Imperial Mausoleum of Emperor Keiko, although that was thoughtlessly changed to that of Emperor Sujin's in February 1865, right before the completion of the restoration.

sen.j: これなどは、考古学の遺跡名に陵墓名を持ち込むと混乱を引き起こす原因になる好例である。
sen.e: This is a typical example that the mixed usage of the archaeological name and the Imperial name of the tumulus could cause this kind of confusion.
This is a typical example that the mixed usage of the archaeological name and the Imperial name of the tumulus could cause this kind of confusion.
This is a typical example that the mixed usage of the archaeological name and the Imperial name of the tumulus could cause this kind of confusion.

sen.j: 宮内庁の管轄する古墳であるので、研究者や国民は、自由に立ち入りできない。
sen.e: This tumulus is under the control of the Imperial Household Agency, thus a general public including the archaeological scholars are not allowed to enter the site without permission from the agency.
This tumulus is under the control of the Imperial Household Agency, thus a general public including the archaeological scholars are not allowed to enter the site without permission from the agency.
This tumulus is under the control of the Imperial Household Agency, thus a general public including the archaeological scholars are not allowed to enter the site without permission from the agency.

tit.e: The scale and the form of the tumulus
The scale and the form of the tumulus
The scale and the form of the tumulus

sen.j: 墳丘は全長が242メートル、正円形で3段築成の後円部は直径158メートル、高さ23メートル。
sen.e: This tumulus has 242m in its length, while its precise circular shaped rear-end in three steps has the diameter in 158m and the height in 23m.
This tumulus has 242m in its length, while its precise circular shaped rear-end in three steps has the diameter in 158m and the height in 23m.
This tumulus has 242m in its length, while its precise circular shaped rear-end in three steps has the diameter in 158m and the height in 23m.

sen.j: 後円部頂上は平坦で円形である。
sen.e: The top end of the circular rear-end part is in a flat circle.
The top end of the circular rear-end part is in a flat circle.
The top end of the circular rear-end part is in a flat circle.

sen.j: 前方部正面は、わずかであるが弧状をなしている。
sen.e: The front edge line of the rectangular frontage is slightly arced.
The front edge line of the rectangular frontage is slightly arced.
The front edge line of the rectangular frontage is slightly arced.

sen.j: その頂上は、くびれ部に向かって少しずつ低く坂のように整形されている。
sen.e: The top edge line of this arc-end mound is slightly inclined to have a slope toward the depressed center.
The top edge line of this arc-end mound is slightly inclined to have a slope toward the depressed center.
The top edge line of this arc-end mound is slightly inclined to have a slope toward the depressed center.

sen.j: 後円部直径と前方部直径比は、10.8 程度である。
sen.e: The ration of the dimension between the diameter of the circular rear-end and the length of the diagonal line of the rectangular frontage is about 10:8.
sen.cmt: 原文、「前方部直径」としていますが、方形は直径で表せませんので対角線長としました。また、比率について「10.8」とありますが、「10:8」の間違いではないかと思われます。訳文ではそのようにしました。
sen.e: The ration of the dimension between the diameter of the circular rear-end and the length of the diagonal line of the rectangular frontage is about 10:8.
The ration of the dimension between the diameter of the circular rear-end and the length of the diagonal line of the rectangular frontage is about 10:8.

sen.j: 渡り土堤が後円部南側と前方部にあり、築造当初から設けられていたと推定されている。
sen.e: There are bridges by the soil embankments go across the surrounding moat at the south side of the circular rear-end and the rectangular frontage, presumably existed from the beginning as the original features.
sen.cmt: 写真を見ると原文の通りではありませんが、そのまま訳しています。
sen.e: There are bridges by the soil embankments go across the surrounding moat at the south side of the circular rear-end and the rectangular frontage, presumably existed from the beginning as the original features.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: There are bridges by the soil embankments go across the surrounding moat at the south side of the circular rear-end and the rectangular frontage, presumably existed from the beginning as the original features.

sen.j: 周濠の形状は左右対称の盾形とされている。
sen.e: The surrounding moat of the tumulus was presumably in symmetrical, shield-like shape.
sen.cmt: 「盾型とされている。」とありますが、写真や資料などがあるのですから現在形状はわかっており、文が推定の形をとっている理由がわかりません。写真を見ると現在は左右対称の盾型ではないので、「盾型であったとされている。」が正しいのではないでしょうか。訳ではそのようにしました。
sen.e: The surrounding moat of the tumulus was presumably in symmetrical, shield-like shape.
The surrounding moat of the tumulus was presumably in symmetrical, shield-like shape.

sen.j: すぐ東に櫛山古墳がある。
sen.e: There is Kushiyama Tumulus right next to this tumulus on the east side.
There is Kushiyama Tumulus right next to this tumulus on the east side.
There is Kushiyama Tumulus right next to this tumulus on the east side.
